Html:
I want to create a program that converts CEC input from a TV into generic keyboard input. At the moment, I'm just trying to get keyboard buttons to be simulated.

So far, this library rocks. It has made a lot of what I want to do so much easier. I've been using it by setting hotkeys that when pressed, simulates a keyboard press.

This works for everything I have tried (space, enter, backspace) and needed except my arrow keys. The hotkey works and the code runs, but my text cursor in Notepad doesn't move.

The code used is just this:
  InputSimulator kb= new InputSimulator();
  kb.Keyboard.KeyPress(VirtualKeyCode.LEFT);
So while I can delete characters, return new lines, add spaces, etc. I can't move the text cursor as you would by pressing the arrow keys.

The arrow keys are necessary for my application to be useful, so if I can't get this to work I'll have to put it on hold.

Hey DeusRex,

Did you end up finding a solution?

Mike
